TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SecKeyChain extends System.Object
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SecKeyChain extends System.Object implements class MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.INativeObject

Docs.summary: Access to the operating system keychain.

remarks.para: This class can be used to add, remove, update or query the iOS or MacOS keychain. MacOS is limited to a single kind of password (SecKind.InternetPassword) while iOS offers a wider range of options.
Use to get values from the keychain as a binary blob. Some of the overloads can also return binary blobs that are suitable to be stored on disk, or passed to another process.
Use to get a , a or a back from the keychain.
Use to get a strongly typed SecRecord with the results of your query.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Add (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord record);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Add(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord record) cil managed

Docs.param: A populated record.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified record to the keychain.

MemberSignature.Value: public IntPtr Handle { get; }
.property instance native int Handle

Docs.summary: Handle (pointer) to the unmanaged object representation.
Docs.remarks: This IntPtr is a handle to the underlying unmanaged representation for this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object QueryAsConcreteType (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, out MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result);
.method public static hidebysig object QueryAsConcreteType(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
Returns the status code from calling SecItemCopyMatching.
Docs.summary: Use this method to query the KeyChain and get back a , a or a .
Docs.returns: An object that can be one of , a or a or null if there is no value found.

remarks.para: This method will throw an exception if the KeyChain contains a new data type that you have introduced with a newer version of Xamarin.iOS into the keychain and you then try to use this with an older version that does not have the ability of decoding theve value.
This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnRef set to true.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData QueryAsData (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData QueryAsData(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
Docs.summary: Fetches an NSData record from the Keychain.
Docs.returns: The NSData associated with the given query.

remarks.para: The returned NSData is a binary blob, if you want to get a high-level representation, use instead.

The returned NSData is not suitable for storing on disk or passing to another process. If you want that, you should use the overload that takes the bool wantPersistentReference parameter and set that to true.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true and kSecMatchLimit to 1, forcing a single record to be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData[] QueryAsData (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, int max);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData[] QueryAsData(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, int32 max) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
Maximum number of values to return.
Docs.summary: Fetches a set of NSData records from the Keychain.
Docs.returns: An array of NSData records associated with the given query.

remarks.para: The returned NSData is a binary blob, if you want to get a high-level representation, use instead.

The returned NSData is not suitable for storing on disk or passing to another process. If you want that, you should use the overload that takes the bool wantPersistentReference parameter and set that to true.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true and kSecMatchLimit set to the value of max, forcing that many record to be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData QueryAsData (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, bool wantPersistentReference, out MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode status);

.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSData QueryAsData(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, bool wantPersistentReference, valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode status) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
If set to true, the returned NSData can be stored on disk for later used, or shared between processes.
Returns the status code from calling SecItemCopyMatching.
Docs.summary: Fetches a set of NSData records from the Keychain.
Fetches an NSData record from the Keychain.
Docs.returns: The NSData associated with the given query.

remarks.para: The returned NSData is a binary blob, if you want to get a high-level representation, use instead.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true and kSecMatchLimit to 1, forcing a single record to be returned. If wantPersistentReference is true, this also sets the kSecReturnPersistentRef dictionary key to true.

If set to true, the returned NSData can be stored on disk for later used, or shared between processes.
Maximum number of values to return.
Returns the status code from calling SecItemCopyMatching.
Docs.summary: Fetches a set of NSData records from the Keychain.
Docs.returns: An array of NSData records associated with the given query.

remarks.para: The returned NSData is a binary blob, if you want to get a high-level representation, use instead.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true and kSecMatchLimit set to the value of max, forcing that many record to be returned. If wantPersistentReference is true, this also sets the kSecReturnPersistentRef dictionary key to true.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord QueryAsRecord (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, out MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord QueryAsRecord(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
Returns the status code from calling SecItemCopyMatching.

remarks.para: Unlike the methods which return a binary blob inside an NSData, this returns a strongly typed SecRecord that you can easily inspect.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true, kSecReturnAttributes set to true and kSecMatchLimit set to 1, forcing a single record to be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord[] QueryAsRecord (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, int max, out MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord[] QueryAsRecord(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, int32 max, valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode result) cil managed

Docs.param: The query used to lookup the value on the keychain.
Maximum number of values to return.
Returns the status code from calling SecItemCopyMatching.
Docs.returns: Returns an array of strongly typed SecRecord objects.

remarks.para: Unlike the methods which return a binary blob inside an NSData, this returns a strongly typed SecRecord that you can easily inspect.

This is the strongly typed equivalent of calling the Security's framework SecItemCopyMatching method with the kSecReturnData set to true, kSecReturnAttributes set to true and kSecMatchLimit set to max, which returns at most that many records.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Remove (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord record);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Remove(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord record) cil managed

Docs.param: Record to be removed from the keychain.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified record from the keychain.
Docs.returns: The status code from performing the remove operation.
Docs.remarks: This calls the SecItemDelete method on the keychain.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Update (MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord newAttributes);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype MonoTouch.Security.SecStatusCode Update(class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord query, class MonoTouch.Security.SecRecord newAttributes) cil managed

Docs.param: The query to use to update the records on the keychain.
The updated record value to store.
Docs.summary: Updates the record matching the query with the provided data.

remarks.para: This performs an update on the keychain.
This calls the SecItemUpdate method.
